title: Kim Crawford 2014 Small Parcels Wild Grace Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: Full-bodied, plush and ripe, this is a bit of a throwback style of Chardonnay, marrying peach, vanilla and mango notes into a delectable whole. Toasted oak gives a bit of structure without straitjacketing the luscious fruit. Drink now–2018.

title: Lasseter 2013 Chemin de Fer Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: A longtime proponent of Rhône blends, this producer combines 60% Grenache, 23% Mourvèdre and 17% Syrah to full-bodied, ripely robust effect, all from estate-grown fruit. Smoky, charred oak and spicy acidity wrap around lush blackberry, cherry and tar, with plenty of grip to show on the finish.

title: Melville 2014 Estate Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's intriguing precision to the nose of this bottling from Chad Melville and family. A laser-sharp line of tart elderberry, black-plum skins and black-cherry skins cut through the dark earth, tar and purple-flower elements. The palate blends approachable black raspberry, dark strawberry and muddled mulberry fruit with touches of coffee and dark cocoa.

title: Domaine Girard 2015 Philippe Girard Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)
description: Produced in the typical flinty (silex) soil of parts of Sancerre, this wine has a crisp steely texture that is balanced by the ripe yellow fruit. The combination is both taut and ripe, giving good balance and tension. Drink this wine from 2017 to allow it to develop further.

title: Domaine le Virolys 2015  Viré-Clessé
description: This is a newly created estate of 27 acres based in the twin villages of Viré and Clessé. It is attractive—full of apple and pear fruits and with a balanced touch of acidity. The fruitiness and crisp acidity make the wine drinkable young. With its tangy tangerine aftertaste, the wine is ready.

title: Four Vines 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This beautiful wine has aromas as ripe as dried figs, flavors as deep as blackberries falling off the vine, and a welcoming, broad texture that begs for another sip. While full bodied, it's easy to relax into.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2014 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)
description: Grown on flinty soil, this strongly mineral-driven wine is structured, tense with acidity and white stone-fruit flavors. The initial crispness opens out into a concentrated, textured wine that will need to age further. Drink from late 2017.

title: Edmeades 2013 Perli Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Concentrated, bright and focused fruit flavors feel shaped by a moderate oak influence in this full-bodied and nicely structured wine. A good amount of tannin wraps the raspberry and blackberry flavors in a firm texture.

title: Head High 2014 Red (North Coast)
description: Beautifully concentrated and rich, this wine is so dense with black fruit and dark-chocolate flavors that it's almost chewy. Blended from nine grape varieties, it has a wealth of fine-grained tannins and feels velvety in texture, while the powerful, layered flavors linger on the finish.

title: Domaine Trouillet 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This is a ripe impressive style of Pouilly. It has all the right minerality along with a rich texture plus melon and yellow fruits. With concentration and acidity in equal measure, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2014  Meursault
description: This is a smooth and rounded wine that has a fine kick of acidity to keep it crisp. With toast and lemon juice blending well together, the wine is rich while also showing a mineral texture. This is a refreshing delicious wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: N. Kendall Wines 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
description: While ethereal in structure, there's a seductively penetrating appeal to this light-footed Pinot Noir. Initially pronounced notes of smoke, dried herb and cedar fade into a dusty rose and cherry perfume. Blossom and sage aromas extend into the palate, lending a sultry flair to brisk Maraschino cherry and raspberry flavors. The finish extends on a pleasant bite of bitter almond.

title: N. Kendall Wines 2013 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty mineral and pollen notes lend earthy complexity to tart lemon, tangerine and sugar cookie notes on the nose of this feather-light Riesling. It's gossamer in texture yet full of juicy sweet pink-grapefruit flavor. High-toned acidity drives a cutting finish marked by a pleasantly bitter ring of lime pith and hazelnut skins.

title: Reininger 2012 Mr. Owl's Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a unique blend of Malbec (60%), Syrah (20%), Merlot (15%) and Petit Verdot. It opens with brooding but alluring aromas of dark plum, asphalt, and a kiss of baking spice. The flavors are full bodied and palate coating, showing weight but also a sense of suppleness that charms the senses.

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2014 Château d'Antigny La Rue du Port  (Pommard)
description: This village wine comes from a parcel of low-yielding 70-year-old vines. It is firm and concentrated with a strong layer of tannins over black fruits. Blackberry and black plum are balanced by the acidity. Together with the tannins, they promise aging. Drink from 2018.
designation: Château d'Antigny La Rue du Port

title: Marisco Vineyards 2014 A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Unlike Marisco's 2015 The Ned Late Harvest, this is a botrytis-affected wine, featuring a darker color and more complex flavors. The aromas suggest Earl Grey tea and honey; the flavors resemble caramel-drizzled orange segments. A slightly bitter citrus-pith note marks the finish, providing balance.
designation: A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai

title: Market Vineyards 2012 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is an expressive wine, with notes of toast, vanilla, baking spices and dark fruit. The palate is full bodied but well balanced, showing a pleasing interplay of fruit and barrel flavors that continues through the finish.

title: Maryhill 2013 Proprietor's Reserve Rosso Granato Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Art Den Hoed Petite Sirah (80%) and Gunkel Vineyard Zinfandel. Aromas of barrel spice, vanilla, raspberry and purple fruit are followed by full-bodied palate-coating fruit flavors, brightened by fresh acidity. The interest is as much about feel as flavor.

title: Priest Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Grenache Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grown on the eastern flank of the Napa Valley's Vaca Mountains, this white dazzles in juicy acidity and creamy texture, finding the best of both sides of the coin. Seamless and focused in tastes of pear and nectarine, it adds notes of stone and spice.

title: Stark-Condé 2013 Three Pines Syrah (Jonkershoek Valley)
description: This wine is a bit shy and reserved out of the gate, needing time to open up and better express its black berry and cherry fruit core that's graced with hints of black tea, heather and licorice root. The medium-weight palate is plush and structured, with a full boysenberry flavor and gripping tannins that linger through the peppery finish. Drink 2018–2022.

title: Monte del Frà 2011 Lena di Mezzo Scarnocchio  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Aromas suggesting resin, mature plum, forest floor, exotic spice, leather and black currant emerge on this solidly structured red. The firm palate offers espresso, raisin, cherry marinated in spirits, fig, licorice and chewing tobacco alongside firm, close-grained tannins that clutch the finish.

title: Monteci 2009 Costa delle Corone  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: Resin, cake spice, crushed blue flower and baked plum aromas lead the way. The powerfully structured palate delivers chewing tobacco, raisin, dried black cherry and licorice framed in robust well-knit tannins.

title: JM Cellars 2013 Tre Faniciulli Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon (74%), with the balance equally split between Syrah and Merlot. Jammy aromas of spice, clove, blackberry and black currant are followed by full-bodied dark-fruit flavors that bring an irresistible sense of deliciousness.

title: Salentein 2013 Numina Gran Corte Red (Valle de Uco)
description: Leathery black-fruit aromas veer a bit towards prune while also showing cheesy oak. This blend features all five Bordeaux grapes, with Malbec in the lead, and it's lively due to pumped-up acidity. Black-fruit flavors are energetic even as this finishes with an echo of raisin. Drink through 2021.

title: Soos Creek 2013 Champoux Vineyard Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon and one-third Cabernet Franc. The aromas are brooding with high-toned notes of mortared herbs and garden flowers along with an underlayer of earth and macerated cherries. The palate is focused and layered with waves of fruit flavors that need time to come together.

title: Soos Creek 2013 Stampede Pass Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine blends fruit from Slide Mountain, Dineen and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. The aromas of herb and black cherry are vibrant while the flavors are rich, ripe and flavorful, still displaying a fine sense of balance.

title: Sottomarino 2013 Primitivo (Mendocino County)
description: Boisterous berry flavors and mouth-gripping texture make this full-bodied wine a lot of fun to taste. It almost gushes with ripe boysenberry and cherry on top of firm tannins, with a lively mouthfeel.

title: Tedeschi 2010 Capitel Monte Olmi Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: You'll discover aromas of leafy underbrush, grilled herb, raisin, new leather and a whiff of blue flower on this bold red. The syrupy concentrated palate doles out raspberry jam, stewed prune, anise and nutmeg framed in big chewy tannins. A confectionery note closes the finish.

title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2014 Les Robées  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: While this domaine is based in Chaintré it also has vines in Pouilly-Fuissé. This wine comes from a 2.4-acre vineyard on the clay and chalk soil that marks this appellation. It is rich, full in the mouth with a mineral texture and lively acidity. It is still young and will be better from late 2017.

title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Le Clos  (Vouvray)
description: This single-vineyard wine has great aging potential. The minerality and tension in this wine with its apple fruit and texture is still resolving itself. Wait at least until 2019 before drinking.
